posts._title: Arthur Maria Rabenalt – Achtung! Feind hört mit! (1940)
posts.title: Achtung! Feind hört mit!
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Action takes place in a factory producing cables for barrage balloons shortly after the critical September days in 1938. British Intelligence try to discover the production secrets and one of their agents is very active in the factory. The agent plays on the vanity of the owner’s secretary, takes advantage of losses at the gaming …

posts.title: Stefanies Geschenk
posts.excerpt: Quote:Sweet, 12 year-old Stefanie, played by child model Soraya Da Mota, dreams of attacking her parents with a flail. Not because they treat her particularly badly, you understand, but because, like any right minded-adolescent, Stefanie is rebelling against normality. As she escapes into a fantasy world, the boundaries between dream and reality blur until, real …

posts.title: Interview
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Ranjit is a young man who has been assured a lucrative job in an Indo-British firm by a family friend. All he has to do is turn up for the interview dressed in a western-style suit. As luck would have it, all city laundries are on strike that morning, and his only suit is dirty. …

posts._title: Issa López – Vuelven AKA Tigers Are Not Afraid (2017)
posts.title: Vuelven
posts.excerpt: Quote:A dark fairy tale about a gang of five children trying to survive the horrific violence of the cartels and the ghosts created every day by the drug war.

posts.title: Interdevochka
posts.excerpt: Intergirl is a film adaptation of the eponymous book by Vladimir Kunin, set in Leningrad (St. Petersburg) in the time of “perestroika” during the 1980s. Tatyana is a beautiful Russian nurse who is underpaid at her hospital job, so she turns a prostitute catering to international tourists. She becomes well paid in dollars, and helps …

posts._title: Masayuki Suo – Katsuben! AKA Talking the Pictures (2019)
posts.title: Katsuben!
posts.excerpt: Quote:Set in early 20th Century Japan, the movie follows the adventures of a young man who wants to get into the movie business — but in a job unique to his country: a dramatic narrator for silent movies known as “Katsubenshi” or just “benshi”. posts._title: Patrick Tam – Xue zai shao AKA Burning Snow (1988)
posts.title: Xue zai shao
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:A young woman is forced to marry an older man who runs a roadhouse saloon. She is constantly being raped by her husband, a drunken loutish brute. posts._title: Tun Fei Mou – The End of the Track (1970)
posts.title: The End of the Track
posts.excerpt: Quote:Tong and Yong-sheng are inseparable playmates, but after Yong-sheng dies in an accident, Tong falls into a dark spiral. At the time, this film was banned due to its homosexual overtones and ideology, while some felt that certain segments drew comparison with CHEN Ying-zhen’s short story The Noodle Stall.

posts._title: Juan López Moctezuma – The Mansion of Madness (1973)
posts.title: The Mansion of Madness
posts.excerpt: A mysterious man is sent deep into the forest to investigate the bizarre behavior of the notorious Dr. Tarr. What he stumbles upon is the doctor’s torture dungeon, a hellish asylum completely cut off from civilization and presided over by the ultimate madman. Innocent people have been savagely chained, tortured and stuck in glass cages, …
